Module for timers.

Types

Timer = object
  totalTime: Duration
  timeLeft: Duration
  callback: TimerCallback
  isLooping: bool
  Source   Edit 
TimerCallback = proc ()
  Source   Edit

Procs

proc callDelayed(callback: TimerCallback; waitFor: Duration) {.inline,
    ...raises: [], tags: [].}
Convenience proc for calling functions after some delay.   Source   Edit 
proc callLooping(id: TimerId; callback: TimerCallback; period: Duration) {.
    inline, ...raises: [], tags: [].}
Convenience proc for starting a timer loop.   Source   Edit 
proc newTimer(id: TimerId; waitFor: Duration; callback: TimerCallback;
              isLooping: bool = false) {....raises: [], tags: [].}
Creates a new timer. The callback will be called after the given time period. If the timer is looping, it will be called again and again until the timer is stopped.   Source   Edit 
proc stopTimer(id: TimerId) {.inline, ...raises: [], tags: [].}
Stops a timer.   Source   Edit 
proc updateTimers(delta: Duration) {....raises: [Exception], tags: [RootEffect].}
Function to be called every frame to update the timers   Source   Edit

Templates

template delay(waitFor: Duration; code: untyped): untyped
Convenience template for running code after some delay.   Source   Edit 
template startLoop(id: TimerId; period: Duration; code: untyped): untyped
Convenience templated for starting a timer loop out of arbitrary code.   Source   Edit
